articles.headline: Pete Buttigieg Is in Bad Shape With Black Democrats. Here’s Why.
articles.snippet: No Democrat in modern times has won the party’s nomination without claiming majorities of black voters, the most crucial voting bloc in South Carolina and an array of delegate-rich states.
articles.abstract: No Democrat in modern times has won the party’s nomination without claiming majorities of black voters, the most crucial voting bloc in South Carolina and an array of delegate-rich states.
articles.lead_paragraph: Former Vice President Joseph R. Biden Jr. has 154 endorsements from current or former black or Hispanic elected officials. Senator Kamala Harris has 93. Senator Bernie Sanders has 91. Senator Cory Booker has 50. Senator Elizabeth Warren has 43.

articles.headline: Israel’s Netanyahu Indicted on Charges of Fraud, Bribery and Breach of Trust
articles.snippet: The first prosecution of a sitting Israeli premier deepens the political paralysis in a country that has had two inconclusive elections this year, and may be headed to a third vote.
articles.abstract: The first prosecution of a sitting Israeli premier deepens the political paralysis in a country that has had two inconclusive elections this year, and may be headed to a third vote.
articles.lead_paragraph: JERUSALEM — Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu was indicted Thursday on charges of bribery, fraud and breach of trust in a set of long-running corruption cases, throwing his political future into doubt and heightening the uncertainty and chaos surrounding Israel’s fitful, yearlong struggle to choose its next leader.

articles.headline: A Former Fox News Executive Divides Americans Using Russian Tactics
articles.snippet: An investigation found that several sites owned by Ken LaCorte push inflammatory items — stories, petitions and the occasional conspiracy theory — to the public.
articles.abstract: An investigation found that several sites owned by Ken LaCorte push inflammatory items — stories, petitions and the occasional conspiracy theory — to the public.
articles.lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO — At first glance, the websites Conservative Edition News and Liberal Edition News have only one thing in common: Both have been carefully curated to inflame America’s culture wars.

articles.headline: Fiona Hill Testifies ‘Fictions’ on Ukraine Pushed by Trump Help Russia
articles.snippet: The former top White House aide denounced a theory that Ukraine interfered in the 2016 election, as she tied the president’s pressure campaign to Russian efforts to sow political divisions in America.
articles.abstract: The former top White House aide denounced a theory that Ukraine interfered in the 2016 election, as she tied the president’s pressure campaign to Russian efforts to sow political divisions in America.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — A former White House Russia expert on Thursday sharply denounced a “fictional narrative” embraced by President Trump and his Republican allies that Ukraine, not Russia, interfered in the 2016 election, testifying that the claim was a fabrication by Moscow that had harmed the United States.
articles.byline: By Nicholas Fandos and Michael D. Shear

articles.headline: The Impeachment Witnesses Not Heard
articles.snippet: With its public hearings over, the House Intelligence Committee plans to move forward without testimony by some of the key players in the Ukraine drama.
articles.abstract: With its public hearings over, the House Intelligence Committee plans to move forward without testimony by some of the key players in the Ukraine drama.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — In recent days, lawmakers were told that when President Trump ramped up his campaign to pressure Ukraine into helping him against his domestic political rivals, he directed advisers to his personal lawyer. “Talk with Rudy,” he instructed. But one thing lawmakers will not do is talk with Rudy.

articles.headline: They Toil Gladly Offstage. Impeachment Lands Them in the Spotlight.
articles.snippet: Normally faceless, a parade of Washington’s career professionals has offered meticulous testimony and told uniquely American stories.
articles.abstract: Normally faceless, a parade of Washington’s career professionals has offered meticulous testimony and told uniquely American stories.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — They are, in a sense, the permanent, beating, bipartisan heart of the government of the United States.

articles.headline: The Jungle Prince of Delhi
articles.snippet: For 40 years, journalists chronicled the eccentric royal family of Oudh, deposed aristocrats who lived in a ruined palace in the Indian capital. It was a tragic, astonishing story. But was it true?
articles.abstract: For 40 years, journalists chronicled the eccentric royal family of Oudh, deposed aristocrats who lived in a ruined palace in the Indian capital. It was a tragic, astonishing story. But was it true?
articles.lead_paragraph: NEW DELHI — On a spring afternoon in 2016, when I was working in India, I received a telephone message from a recluse who lived in a forest in the middle of Delhi.

articles.headline: With Big Tech in Their Path, Start-Ups Turn to Business Markets
articles.snippet: The move of entrepreneurs, engineers and venture investors away from the consumer internet and to enterprise software has piqued regulator interest.
articles.abstract: The move of entrepreneurs, engineers and venture investors away from the consumer internet and to enterprise software has piqued regulator interest.
articles.lead_paragraph: When Rajiv Ayyangar and two other Yahoo alumni explored start-up ideas, they experimented with concepts directed at the public, like a personal finance app. But making money from consumers was too daunting, they concluded, partly because of the tight grip that digital giants like Google and Apple had over distribution.
articles.byline: By Steve Lohr and Erin Griffith

articles.headline: Why Everyone Is Angry at Facebook Over Its Political Ads Policy
articles.snippet: The social network is said to be discussing changes that include restricting how precisely campaigns can reach specific groups.
articles.abstract: The social network is said to be discussing changes that include restricting how precisely campaigns can reach specific groups.
articles.lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO — After Google announced restrictions on political advertising this week, campaign strategists in Washington quickly turned their attention to a different company: Facebook.

articles.headline: The Parents Passed a Drug Test. Should They Get Their Children Back?
articles.snippet: Ohio counties want to reunite families that were separated because of drug use. But prioritizing that ideal has had deadly consequences.
articles.abstract: Ohio counties want to reunite families that were separated because of drug use. But prioritizing that ideal has had deadly consequences.
articles.lead_paragraph: PORTSMOUTH, Ohio — Dylan Groves had suffered tremendously long before his tiny body was found in June at the bottom of a 30-foot well, decomposed and wrapped in plastic bags. He had been born a few months earlier with several drugs in his system, and had spent his first days in the care of a foster mother who had cuddled him while he shook and sweated through withdrawal.

articles.headline: China’s Vaping Boom Alarms the Government
articles.snippet: For years, Chinese e-cigarette makers had free rein to operate without regard to consumer safety. But new rules are set to change that.
articles.abstract: For years, Chinese e-cigarette makers had free rein to operate without regard to consumer safety. But new rules are set to change that.
articles.lead_paragraph: Models in tight dresses and high heels lounged in a yellow inflatable pool filled with plush toys and vaping equipment. Enthusiastic vapers lined up for free pens and pods, as clouds of mango, mint and rose mingled with the electronic dance music in the air.
articles.byline: By Sui-Lee Wee and Elsie Chen

articles.headline: Imagine Being on Trial. With Exonerating Evidence Trapped on Your Phone.
articles.snippet: Public defenders lack access to gadgets and software that could keep their clients out of jail.
articles.abstract: Public defenders lack access to gadgets and software that could keep their clients out of jail.
articles.lead_paragraph: On April 27, a woman in eastern Brooklyn called the police. She told them that just before sunrise, at 5:50 a.m., her ex, John, confronted her on the street with a gun.
